body.p:
To His Excellency B. Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky.

The undersigned were jurors upon the Trial of Rufus Jones at the late term of the Warren Ecquity & Criminal Court and found him guilty of ^the^ Manslaughter of Henry Jenkins & fixed his imprisonment at four years. We did not believe the killing was done with malice, but under sudden heat & passion & hence our verdict -- Yet, altogether we thought under the law we were compelled to find this verdict, the youth of Jury, the connection between the two families, the intimacy & kindness between the Jury & the deceased, and the total absence of anything like a malicious heart induce us to ask that your Excellency will interpose as the Constitution empowers you & relieve him from the punishment which he must otherwise suffer --

Most Respectfully
Wm R Covington
Wm. M. Breedlove
R D Neale
L. P. Arnold
J. B. Posey
J M Thompson
R. S. Scott
T. H. Billingsley
W E Miller

State of Kentucky
Warren County Sct

J L L Cooke Clerk of the Warren Equity & Criminal Court certify that the nine names affixed to the above instrument of are nine out of the twelve Jurors who served w/in the Jury in the trail of Rufus Jones and I further certify that J M Andrew Thomas Ellis & Benjamin Hester were the other there making the twelve Sworn under my hand this 7th March 1861.
